body_content.explanation: relating to or experiencing periods of either depression or mania but not both:
examples: Unipolar depression can involve anxiety and other symptoms - but no manic episodes.

body_content.explanation: in which only one country or area has power:
examples: He argued against a "unipolar" world in which the United States is the only superpower.

body_content.explanation: of a nerve cell, having only one structure projecting (= sticking out) from it:
examples: Unipolar neurons have only a single extension from the cell body.

body_content.explanation: relating to only one pole (= one of two ends where the force is strongest) of a magnet (= an object that attracts and pushes away iron and steel):
examples: The system contains both bipolar and unipolar technologies in one device.
